an8.38:4.1: “Mendicants, a good person is born in a family for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of many people.
an8.38:4.2: For the benefit, welfare, and happiness of mother and father; children and partners; slaves, workers, and servants; friends and colleagues; departed ancestors; the king; the gods; and ascetics and brahmins.
an8.38:5.1: It’s like a great rain cloud, which nourishes all the crops for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of many people.
an8.38:5.2: In the same way, a good person is born in a family for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of many people. …”
an8.38:6.3: Neither by day or at night do they neglect
an8.38:7.1: They venerate them in accord with the teaching,
an8.38:7.3: One of settled faith and good nature
an8.38:8.3: Good for the king, good for the gods,
an8.38:8.4: and good for relatives and friends.
an8.38:9.1: In fact, they’re good for everyone,
an8.38:9.2: well grounded in the true teaching.
an8.38:9.3: Rid of the stain of stinginess,
an8.38:9.4: they’ll enjoy a world of bliss.”
